ch.nolix.element._3DGUI

Class Shape<S extends Shape<S>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.entity.Entity<E>
      • ch.nolix.element.core.Element<MU>
        • ch.nolix.element.core.MutableElement<ONE>
          • ch.nolix.element.bases.OptionalNamableElement<CE>
            • ch.nolix.element.bases.ConfigurableElement<S>
              • ch.nolix.element._3DGUI.Shape<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - The type of a shape.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IController, Castable, IFluentObject<S>, ISmartObject<S>, Listable<S>, TypeRequestable, Namable<S>, Named, OptionalNamable<S>, OptionalTokenable<S>, Resettable<S>, Tokenable<S>, Tokened, Configurable<S>, Specifiable<S>, Specified
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseShape, MultiShape

    public abstract class Shape<S extends Shape<S>>
extends ConfigurableElement<S>
    The position of a shape is its smallest (!) position in a left-hand (!) coordination system.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss
